experience: You and Brian both know Tommy Schaeffer, Tim Mortimer, and 33 others

Over the years, Brian has raised more than $3 million in private equity from independent financiers and has developed film production crews to place his plan into action getting feature films off the ground and in theatres and television.Ronalds Brothers Productions successfully produced five independent feature films and 15 short films in fewer than 10 years.•	Involved in all decision-making aspects of the filmmaking process, both creative and logistical. Offered invaluable “out of the box” ideas for staying on or under budget.•	Was responsible for securing over $5 million, scheduling, hiring, and overseeing the production calendar. Utilized a well-established network to bring producers, talent, writers and crew together to realize a creative vision no matter the budgetary constraints. •	Worked to solve problems both large and small, address cast and crew needs, and maintain a calm and comfortable atmosphere on set. Able to wrangle, prioritize and deal with multiple needs and concerns in a timely and efficient manner.•	Ensured all production and shooting deadlines were met.

•	Currently expanding the overall scope of the company’s outreach, including website and social media development, adding thousands of new worldwide fans and followers.•	Instrumental in securing multiple production contracts and dozens of new auditions for clients by enhancing their exposure. •	Organize all elements of event productions, red carpets and networking gatherings, including layout and solicitation of highly targeted guest lists.•	Facilitate networking and relationships between clients, media, photographers (Wire Image, Getty Images, etc.) and producers, resulting in countless job opportunities. •	Utilize social media to promote and expand awareness of seasoned and up-and-coming actors.

Successfully worked with multi-million dollar real estate developers and landowners to incorporate preferred provider agreements within new developments for service.•	Developed relationships with Builders and Developers for Single Family Homes, Apartments and Condominiums.•	Negotiate exclusive marketing and service agreements for voice, video and data services.•	Responsible for managing an assigned CO, growing the reach, profitability and absorption of Qwest telecommunications product offerings in new and existing Master Planned Community and Multi-Family Developments.•	Successful collaboration with Product, Network, Legal and Marketing teams to best partner with the development community in crafting a true Win/Win partnership.

Outside Plant Sr. Designer skilled in Copper, Fiber, Aerial and Buried plant telecom infrastructures.•	Design Engineer Group, DSL Group and Road Projects and Conflict Review Group-Plan, Design, Issue and Capacity Provision F-1and F-2 jobs in a given Wire Center.•	Review road projects, identify conflict if any, Plan, Design, and Issue to construction.•	Delivered superior service to clients and developers.

Leader of an Account Exectuive and Artist team responsible to qualify and monitor all customers, sell advertising scheduling, ad content, and payments on account.•	Meeting and liaising with clients to discuss and identify their advertising requirements.•	Responsible for growing dollar value within a given territory increasing revenue over 20% a year.•	Manage retail clients in designing a marketing campaign.

Brian's one of those folks who really exudes compassion and enthusiasm.  He and his brother Dean are pioneers in Arizona's resurgent independent film community.  Brian is always willing to help the film community through his participation in seminars, showcases and networking events.  His commitment to quality and professionalism in the industry was no more apparent than when I worked with him on the feature film, "The Graves".  As an actor and producer, Brian easily separates those roles and performs effortlessly wearing either hat.

summary: BRIAN RONALDS produced and co-starred in the horror/comedy Netherbeast Incorporated starring Darrell Hammond, Judd Nelson, Dave Foley, Jason Mewes, Robert Wagner, Steve Burns and Amy Davidson, which was released nationwide in 2009. Brian was then brought aboard in 2009 to write for the second season of Tyler Perry's wildly popular TBS sitcom, “Meet the Browns”. In addition, Brian produced and co-starred in the feature film, The Graves, starring Tony Todd, Bill Moseley, Amanda Wyss, Clare Grant and Jillian Murray, which hit theaters nationwide in January 2010.Brian also, wrote, produced and directed with his brother Dean a comedic web series , “HERE & NOW”, starring Judd Nelson, Traci Lords and Alexis Arquette which is an App currently available in the Apple App Store. Brian's third feature film he co-starred and produced was released in early 2012 titled DIRTY LITTLE TRICK starring Dean Cain, Christie Burson and Michael Madsen, and is now available on SHOWTIME.Currently Brian's fourth feature film ASHLEY starring Nicole Fox(America's Next Top Model Winner), Jennifer Taylor(Two and a Half Men) and Michael Madsen(Kill Bill/Reservoir Dogs) hit movie theatre's in 16 cities August 9th 2013. Brian produced the film with Tom Malloy and his brother Dean directed. Most recently, Brian's fifth feature film he produced, GOING BONGO, shot on location in Tanzania, Africa was released in the Summer of 2014.Specialties: Film Finance, Producing Independent Feature Films
name: Brian Ronalds
